name: store-package
description: Create a Json and Zip file based on Store Broker PDPs and Config file
author: Microsoft Corporation
helpMarkDown: Visit our GitHub repository for help on usage for the [package task](https://github.com/Microsoft/windows-dev-center-vsts-extension/blob/master/docs/usage.md##windows-store---package)

inputs.name: serviceEndpoint
inputs.label: Service endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Windows Partner Center endpoint configured with your credentials

inputs.name: sbConfigPath
inputs.label: Config File Full Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full Path to the Config File. If not specified, it will be generated based on the current Prod submission

inputs.name: appNameType
inputs.label: App identification method
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to determine the app to package. This is only required if no config file is provided.

inputs.name: appId
inputs.label: Application ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: ID of the application, found in the URL for the application's page on the Dev Center. This is only required if no config file is provided.

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: Application primary name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Primary name of the application, found at the top of the application's page on the Dev Center. This is only required if no config file is provided.

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder of the packages that the publishing task consume

inputs.name: contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: App packages that are part of the submission. Expect the relative path of the packages with respect to the source folder. Minimatch pattern is supported.

inputs.name: pdpPath
inputs.label: PDP Root Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Your PDPRootPath is expected to be in the following file structure: [PDPRootPath]\\[lang-code]\\...\\[PDPFilename]

inputs.name: pdpMediaPath
inputs.label: Media Root Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: This is where the screenshots and trailers for your listings are stored. Your media must be placed with this structure: [MediaRootPath]\\[Release]\\[lang-code]\\...\img.png. The 'Release' is the 'Release' attribute found at the top of the corresponding PDP file. If MediaRootPath is specified here, it will override the value from the config file. This must be specified here or in your config file if you are specifying `PDP Root Path`.

inputs.name: outSBPackagePath
inputs.label: Output Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Output directory where Store Broker will output generated files out of `New-SubmissionPackage` command. This overrides the value from the config file. [More info](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/SETUP.md#getting-your-pdps)

inputs.name: outSBName
inputs.label: Output Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The common name to use for the .json/.zip pair. If specified, this overrides the value from the config file.

inputs.name: pdpReleasePath
inputs.label: Release
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path to the correct subfolder within 'PDPRootPath' to find the PDP files to use. If specified, this overrides the value from the config file.

inputs.name: pdpInclude
inputs.label: PDP File Names
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of PDP file names that SHOULD be processed. Each line supports wildcards, eg 'ProductDescription*.xml'. Ex: "*.xml.lss", "*.xml.lct". Minimatch is not supported. If specified, this overrides the value from the config file.

inputs.name: pdpExclude
inputs.label: PDP Exclude
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of PDP file names that SHOULD NOT be processed. Each line supports wildcards, eg 'ProductDescription*.xml'. Ex: "*.xml.lss", "*.xml.lct". Minimatch is not supported. If specified, this overrides the value from the config file.

inputs.name: languageExclude
inputs.label: Language Exclude
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of lang-code strings that SHOULD NOT be processed. Each line represents a language code. Ex: "default", "qps-ploc". If specified, this overrides the value from the config file.

inputs.name: logPath
inputs.label: Log Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full path for the Store Broker log file

inputs.name: disableTelemetry
inputs.label: Disable Telemetry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to disable or not the collection of data. See Microsoft's [Privacy Policy](https://privacy.microsoft.com/en-US/privacystatement) and [Terms of Use](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/legal/intellectualproperty/copyright/default.aspx). For specific information on Store Broker's telemetry, see [Store Broker Telemetry](https://github.com/Microsoft/StoreBroker/blob/v2/Documentation/USAGE.md#telemetry)
